metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20316 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way Samba handled file/directory metadata. This flaw allows an authenticated attacker with permissions to read or modify share metadata, to perform this operation outside of the share.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20316` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

ctdb - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, fixing this required a whole rewrite of the VFS layer and there is no reasonable way to fix this in older versions. Marking this CVE as ignored for older releases.

criterions.comment: samba package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
samba package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.16.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
